sections.heading: Basic Information
sections.content:
Step 1 of 7

We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or any other basis prohibited by federal, state, or local law. No question on this form is intended to secure information to be used for such discrimination. The school is required to report some of the information requested below. Your contribution is voluntary. It will be held confidential.

Please note: If you do not hear back from us within two business days, please check your spam/junk mailbox.

pages.title: Take a Tour | O'Brien Aveda Institute
pages.summary: Schedule a tour of O'Brien Aveda Institute. Experience our state-of-the-art facilities and discover why we're the premier beauty school.

sections.heading: Discover Your Future
sections.content:
Take a personalized tour of our campus and see firsthand what makes O'Brien Aveda Institute the perfect place to launch your career in the beauty and wellness industry.

Tour our state-of-the-art classrooms, clinic floor, and student amenities. See where you'll learn and practice your craft in a professional environment.

Connect with our experienced educators who are passionate about helping you succeed. Learn about our curriculum and teaching approach.

Tours are available throughout the week. Submit your request and we'll work with your schedule to find the perfect time.

•45-60 minute guided tour of our campus

•Overview of all program offerings and career opportunities

•Financial aid and scholarship information

•Time for questions and one-on-one discussion

•Opportunity to observe classes in session

Please fill out the form below and we will be in contact with you shortly to schedule a tour.

By submitting this form you agree to receive promotional and event emails from O'Brien Aveda Institute.

pages.title: Admissions | O'Brien Aveda Institute
pages.summary: Join O'Brien Aveda Institute and transform your passion into a rewarding career in beauty and wellness. Learn about our admissions process and requirements.

sections.heading: Section
sections.content: Great people helping great people succeed. Take the first step toward your future in beauty and wellness.

sections.heading: About O'Brien's Aveda Institute
sections.content:
At O'Brien's Aveda Institute, we combine our family's legacy of excellence with Aveda's globally respected curriculum and holistic philosophy. We emphasize personal well-being and environmental responsibility, using Aveda's pure plant essences and sulfate-free, cruelty-free products that connect beauty, wellness, and sustainability.

The beauty industry offers incredible opportunities. Whether you're drawn to fashion and editorial work, salon ownership, or building lasting client relationships, the paths are endless. With Aveda salons commanding premium pricing and our comprehensive training backed by Milady resources, you'll be prepared to succeed and earn well above industry standards. Our passionate team is here to help you master your craft and launch your career.

Class size is limited to enable us to give each student personal attention. If you are interested in learning more, please contact our Admissions Directors at (319) 232-0911, or via e-mail at admissions@obriensavedainstitute.org. Information regarding Admissions is available Monday through Friday 8:00 - 3:30 PM, however you may call and leave a message or email anytime.

Please view the O'Brien Aveda Institute Student Catalog and Guidebook online and print a copy for yourself to better educate yourself on our mission, campus and curriculum.

We suggest visiting www.VTProfessionals.org to review Vermont licensure requirements that may preclude an individual from obtaining employment in the field for which training is provided. After you review this information, click the schedule a tour button to make an appointment to meet with us for an interview and tour.

Bring with you a copy of the following:

•Proof of high school diploma or GED administered by the State of Vermont

•Proof of a Measles Mumps & Rubella (MMR) vaccine

•Copy of your driver's license or ID

•Copy of social security card, birth certificate or passport

•Have read the catalog and all pre-enrollment information and acknowledge that you understand it and assume responsibility for following the rules and regulations set forth by the Vermont State Board of Barbering and Cosmetology, the Vermont Board of Health, and our institutes

•Have reliable transportation for all class sessions, prior to your start date

•Contact the O'Brien Aveda Institute's Financial Aid Department to confirm you have filled out all necessary paperwork; you must have your plan in place to insure you are able to pay for your course

Take the first step toward your new career in beauty and wellness
